description: Paris authorities had been on high alert after last week's incidents in Amsterdam where assaults on Maccabi fans sparked outrage and were widely condemned as antisemitic. Some 4,000 police officers and security staff were deployed in and around the Stade de France at a match attended by French President Emmanuel Macron.
title: France draws with Israel in high-security operation to reach Nations League quarterfinals

description: Trump had indicated during his campaign for the presidency that he planned to hand the portfolio to the nephew of the assassinated president John F. Kennedy. After RFK Jr. abandoned his independent presidential bid in August and endorsed the Republican nominee, Trump said he would let him 'go wild' with health and food policy.
title: Trump nominates Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as health secretary

description: Following the Republican Party's victory in the Senate on November 5, it retained a majority in the House of Representatives. The conservative camp also has a solid Supreme Court majority.
title: A second Trump presidency without any real checks and balances

description: The conspiracy-laden website Infowars made money for its owner Alex Jones by running stories claiming one of America's most notorious school shootings was a hoax.
title: Satirical US site The Onion buys Infowars with the backing of Sandy Hook victims' families

description: India's capital New Delhi was wreathed in blanketing toxic smog this week as worsening air pollution surged past the grim mark of 50 times World Health Organization recommended daily maximum.
title: New Delhi closes all primary schools due to soaring smog levels

description: It would be a mistake to imagine a calmer second Trump term, freed from his recent commitments once in the White House: He's been open about his goals, and has what it takes to succeed, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.
title: 'Trump will strive to achieve as much as possible of what he sold in his campaign'

description: According to the UN, around 100,000 Palestinians have been expelled from this area in the last month. The Israeli army has suggested that they would not be allowed to return. The Israelis seem determined to turn the area into a buffer zone, depopulated and isolated from the rest of the enclave.
title: In northern Gaza, the workings of 'ethnic cleansing'

description: The European Commission said the US tech titan also abused its dominant position by imposing unfair trading conditions on other online classified ads service providers that advertise on its platforms.
title: EU fines Meta €800 million for 'abusive' Facebook ad practices

description: Spain's national weather agency had put parts of the eastern Valencia region under the highest alert level for rain on Wednesday, two weeks after floods killed more than 200 people there.
title: Spain flood epicenter survives latest rain alert

description: This is part of the Labour government's plans to make Britain a clean energy leader.
title: UK announces ban on new coal mines

description: Le Monde's Sylvie Kauffmann is answering readers' questions live.
title: Ask us anything about the consequences of Trump's election on Europe, NATO and the war in Ukraine

description: The author of a new HRW report, Nadia Hardman, explains why the organization concludes that the destruction in the enclave and the forced displacement of Gazans are systematic and part of a 'state policy.'
title: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel of 'crimes against humanity' and 'ethnic cleansing' in Gaza

description: Drastic measures will be taken on Thursday evening to ensure the safety of a match that could see Les Bleus qualify for the quarter-finals of the UEFA Nations League.
title: France hosts Israel in football match overshadowed by the political and security context

description: Faced with a slowdown in business, the luxury goods group is rejuvenating its executive committee. Alexandre Arnault, son of CEO Bernard Arnault, will soon become the second in command of the wines and spirits division.
title: LVMH overhauls its executive committee

description: After Prime Minister Michel Barnier said the trade deal between the EU and four South American countries was 'unacceptable,' Economy Minister Antoine Armand said France was 'employing all means' to block it.
title: France says it's 'employing all means' to block the EU-Mercosur trade pact

description: After Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev made vehement remarks against France, the environment minister canceled her trip to the climate conference. Relations between Baku and Paris, which supports Armenia, have deteriorated sharply.
title: COP29: French environment minister abandons trip amid tensions with Azerbaijan

description: While the first march on Wednesday evening brought together the usual supporters of the Palestinian cause, the second brought together left-wing Jewish organizations opposed to the war. Some were demonstrating for the first time since October 7, 2023.
title: In Paris, two separate protests against far-right pro-Israeli gala Israel is Forever

description: The prosecution requested five years' imprisonment, three of which suspended, and a five-year ban from running for public office against Marine Le Pen, whom they said played a 'central role' in setting up a system of embezzling funds from the European Parliament.
title: Banning Le Pen from running for office would be 'exemplary' response to 'attack' on democracy, prosecutors say

description: Civil Service Minister Guillaume Kasbarian said he was keen to share 'best practices for dealing with excess bureaucracy' with Musk, now Donald Trump's head of 'government efficiency.' These remarks caused unease even in the French prime minister's office.
title: French minister draws ire after congratulating Musk on appointment to Trump administration

description: On Wednesday, Joe Biden hosted the president-elect in an exchange described as 'cordial' by the Democrat. Shortly afterward, Donald Trump appointed Matt Gaetz as attorney general and isolationist Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence.
title: Trump marks returns to Washington with polite White House visit and controversial nominations

description: In the latest battle between the tech giant and a French media union, a Paris court has ordered Google not to remove from search results some articles from media with which it was clashing over rights for use of online news.
title: French court orders Google to halt news search results scheme

description: Amnesty International says French-made weaponry, supplied by the UAE, is being used in Sudan's civil war that has intensified in recent weeks.
title: French-made weapons used in Sudan 'in violation of UN embargo,' reports Amnesty

description: Speaking before members of the European Parliament, the European Union's new high representative for foreign affairs put forward a slightly different vision from the one held by her predecessor, Josep Borrell.
title: Kaja Kallas tells MEPs she will support EU aid to Ukraine until 'victory'

description: Discovering the solar system and the Milky Way is an exciting experience for children. A number of sites offer fun and exciting tours, enabling parents to deepen their knowledge of astronomy and space exploration too.
title: Head in the stars: Five astronomy activities for families around Paris

description: In Baalbek, strikes hit the immediate vicinity of rich Roman remains and damaged churches. Other ancient sites in Tyre and Byblos are under threat. UNESCO's Special Committee for the Protection of Cultural Property in the Event of Armed Conflict will hold a special session devoted to Lebanon on November 18.
title: Israeli bombardment threatens Lebanon's architectural heritage

description: The growing number of redundancy plans is worrying the government, which is meanwhile adopting budgetary measures.
title: French government caught up by social unrest

description: In this documentary, a young activist from Massafer Yatta chronicles the local farmers' stubborn resistance after having been declared illegal on their own land by Israel, since the 1980s.
title: 'No Other Land': A shared Palestinian and Israeli view of West Bank colonization

description: Trump has promised to carry out the country’s largest-ever deportation operation, extend tax breaks and reshape the US economy.
title: Republicans win 218 US House seats, giving Donald Trump and the party control of government

description: Although more developed, the southern regions of the sub-continent are experiencing a steady decline in fertility, a concern for their leaders in terms of their future political representation in parliament.
title: India, the world's most populous country, asks women in its southern states to have more children

description: The incident occurred ahead of a G20 summit taking place next Monday and Tuesday in Rio de Janeiro that will gather leaders from around the world.
title: Man with explosives dies trying to enter Brazil Supreme Court

description: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich had been expected to attend Wednesday's gala, dubbed 'Israel is Forever,' which was planned by an association of the same name. After days of growing criticism of the event, Smotrich's office confirmed Wednesday that the minister would not travel to Paris to participate.
title: Protests erupt in Paris over controversial gala in support of Israel

description: For several months, more and more young people in Zhengzhou had been using bikeshare bikes to cycle to a nearby city some 50 kilometers away. The scale of this phenomenon, though apolitical, prompted authorities to ban it.
title: In China, authorities put an end to Henan students' late-night bike rides

description: The Associated Press called the race for Republican David McCormick last week. As of Wednesday, McCormick led Democratic incumbent Sen. Bob Casey by about 28,000 votes out of more than 6.9 million ballots counted – inside the 0.5% margin threshold to trigger an automatic statewide recount under Pennsylvania law.
title: Pennsylvania Senate contest headed toward a recount

description: Jack Smith’s team has been evaluating how to wind down the classified documents and the federal 2020 election interference case in Washington before Trump takes office because of longstanding Justice Department policy that says sitting presidents cannot be prosecuted.
title: Special counsel Smith asks court to pause appeal seeking to revive Trump's classified documents case

description: Some 10 countries have already signed agreements with industrialized nations before the outcome of the UN climate negotiations.
title: COP29: Africa sees itself as the hub of the future global market in pollution rights
